content: Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 09 Jan 2019Should I quit my first job when I had just finished my appraisal for the probation period?This is my first job as a fresh uni undergraduate. My probation ends this month and I had just went through the appraisal process; however, I have received an interview offer by an even better company with better job prospects. I'm conflicted now as I'm just settling in this company with decent colleagues. Work has been rather easy and filled with menial tasks, and I am bored at work (not challenged). Will making a switch hurt my resume or future prospects? Thanks in advance for any advice :)5 answersAnswerBump0

Yk LaiLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 10 Jan 2019I am not sure about other people. From my working experience in total 3 companies including the current one, 2 are MNC and leaders in the industry, I would only care whether my supervisor is a good leader as long as the company is not notorious of its welfare. The company could the best company, but does not directly make you the best employee unless your supervisor is good. So, if the current company is ok, you have a good supervisor, I think staying to gain more experience is not a bad idea. Otherwise, move.0 comments1
